intro: Descurainia argentea, commonly known as silverleafed tansy, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to North America and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Descurainia argentea is a perennial herb that is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
